frame.name: Being_in_operation
frame.definition:
A Device or machine is in (or out of) service. Note that being broken or functional is a separate issue from being turned on or off. This latter notion is what the present frame is concerned with.
The Time when and the Place where the Device is in use may be specified, as may be the Purpose a backgrounded human User had in turning the Device on or off. The TV is on The lights were off when I came by.

FE.name: Device
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Device</fen> or machine that is in or out of operation.
<ex><fex name="Device">Lights</fex> <m>were</m> <t>on</t> in the primary school </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when a <fen>Device</fen> is in or out of operation.
<ex>I do n't want to turn round cos the lights <m>are</m> <t>on</t> <fex name="Time">at the moment</fex> </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Device</fen> is or is not operating.
<ex> Lights <m>were</m> <t>on</t> <fex name="Place">on the Kingston road bridge</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: on.prep
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of an electrical appliance or system): being functioning

lexUnit.name: off.prep
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of an electrical appliance or power supply) not functioning or so as to cease to function.

lexUnit.name: operate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of an artifact or machine) be active.
